Posts.Content: thanks for the reply, my surgeon suggested an MRI so I think I will follow his advice, If the insurance company will approve it. I don't mind the pain, it isn't constant, as long as I know it is "normal", and not the cancer returning!
Posts.Title: Rib pain months after radiation stops

Posts.Content: On Feb 19, 2009 12:00 AM lovey311 wrote: Hi, I had a lumpectomy last Jan followed by 6.5 weeks of radiation.  I am now taking Femara with the usually side effects but about 8 weeks ago I started experiencing pain under my left breast in the rib area (same side as the bc).  As a precaution my doctor sent me for a bone scan which is negative but still no diag for this pain.  Anyone out there with a similar situation?  Thanks I had a lumpectomy in June 2010, then chemo and 35 weeks radiation. I too have rib pain under my breast, it hurts to touch it, I go back to Fox Chase next week for my second followup with the oncologist and will ask again, My gynocologist said she would never have radiation as she was in pain for years. It is just nice to know that I am not the only one with this problem! you hate to keep complaining, but it hurts when I lay a certain way or with the wrong bra on. I have found the new  Geniebras are the most comfortable. I hate not being able to wear an underwire! Well, enough of my complaining, all you want to know is that the pain is normal and then you deal with it instad of worrying.
Posts.Title: Rib pain months after radiation stops

Posts.Content: Debbie106, I also go to my surgeon for followups along with the oncologist, Mainly because the oncoligist said I didn't need a mammo for a year and the surgeon wants every 6 months, I am more confortable with 6 months. Also my surgeon is local and my oncologist is 2 hours away in the city. Atleast for a while I will continue with both, the radiologist has released me so I don't go there anymore.
Posts.Title: anyone here have a surgeon that does your follow up?

Posts.Content: On Dec 17, 2014 4:29 PM janr888 wrote:     nobody can tell  you who to trust or what to believe ultimately it is not up to us , it is up to that which animates and binds all living things , that which was is and always will be , god,, jehova,, yawah ,allah , call it what you will , it is  not up to us , life comes thru us but it does not come from us  , it does not belong to us ,  just my opinion , I wish you good things ,Thank you, beautifully put!
Posts.Title: SCARED

Posts.Content: On Oct 22, 2014 11:37 PM janr888 wrote:  hi ,    I asked about that , I wanted to get a double masectomy just to be safe .  I was told I had no more chance of  getting cancer in the other breast then I would have if I had never been diagnosised with breast cancer at all . this is all so hard .   Who did you talk to? I should have had it done the first time and now that it's back in the other breast, I really wish I had. So live and learn,
Posts.Title: SCARED

Posts.Content: On Oct 14, 2014 11:59 PM janr888 wrote: I can't help thinking if you had had the masectomy when you were diagonsised you would not be facing this now.   I really can't understand why some people are so concerned about keeping thier breasts. Three out of 4 people who refuse treatment die, why would anyone choose that>   I respect your right to follow your instincts but I think your wrong not to listen to your doctors , I think your so wrong .  Why is it a either or situation anyway, can't you do both.   It is not about scaring you for the sake of scaring you , why would anybody want to do that , they don't profit from that. They are trying to keep you alive, wake up before it is to late . Hi, here it is Christmas Day and I am sitting here recuperating from a double mastectomy with reconstruction. Yes I had cancer 5 years ago I. My right breast with chemo and radiation, because it was triple negative. Now last month my mammo showed something In left breast, my fist visit this time was take them off, I am tired of worrying about this. This time wasn't triple negative, and was less than 1 cm, and all I wanted to hear when I woke was, sentional node clear. I was so worried about the reconstruction and mastectomy that sometimes I forgot about the cancer and I had to step back and say this not elective surgery, this is my life. Believe me the mastectomy is not really a big deal, there is not much pain involved. It is the reconstruction that I would like to stick a knife in! Not so much pain, I am just on Tylenol after surgery one week ago, but the drains, a pain in the butt, the tightness, maybe I should have given this more thought! I'm sure I will be fine with the end result! Just make.sure you have a wonderful oncologist , surgeon, and plastic surgeon (preferably female) , they even had a breast coordinator at the hospital that set up all my apps , follow ups , she was a life saver. Enough about me, just know if you choose a mastectomy it is not the end of the world, it will give you a sense of peace, you're doing this to save your life. Much easier than chemo and radiation !!
Posts.Title: SCARED
